info.title: Hyperswitch - API Documentation
info.description:
## Get started

Hyperswitch provides a collection of APIs that enable you to process and manage payments.
Our APIs accept and return JSON in the HTTP body, and return standard HTTP response codes.

You can consume the APIs directly using your favorite HTTP/REST library.

We have a testing environment referred to "sandbox", which you can setup to test API calls without
affecting production data.
Currently, our sandbox environment is live while our production environment is under development
and will be available soon.
You can sign up on our Dashboard to get API keys to access Hyperswitch API.

### Environment

Use the following base URLs when making requests to the APIs:

| Environment   |  Base URL                          |
|---------------|------------------------------------|
| Sandbox       | <https://sandbox.hyperswitch.io>   |
| Production    | <https://api.hyperswitch.io>       |

## Authentication

When you sign up on our [dashboard](https://app.hyperswitch.io) and create a merchant
account, you are given a secret key (also referred as api-key) and a publishable key.
You may authenticate all API requests with Hyperswitch server by providing the appropriate key in
the request Authorization header.

| Key             |  Description                                                                                  |
|-----------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| api-key         | Private key. Used to authenticate all API requests from your merchant server                  |
| publishable key | Unique identifier for your account. Used to authenticate API requests from your app's client  |

Never share your secret api keys. Keep them guarded and secure.

get.summary: List payment methods for a Merchant
get.description:
List payment methods for a Merchant

To filter and list the applicable payment methods for a particular Merchant ID
get.operationId: List all Payment Methods for a Merchant

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the merchant account

parameters.name: accepted_country
parameters.description: The two-letter ISO currency code

parameters.name: accepted_currency
parameters.description: The three-letter ISO currency code

parameters.name: minimum_amount
parameters.description: The minimum amount accepted for processing by the particular payment method.

parameters.name: maximum_amount
parameters.description: The maximum amount amount accepted for processing by the particular payment method.

parameters.name: recurring_payment_enabled
parameters.description: Indicates whether the payment method is eligible for recurring payments

parameters.name: installment_payment_enabled
parameters.description: Indicates whether the payment method is eligible for installment payments

404.description: Payment Methods does not exist in records

get.description:
Merchant Connector - List

List Merchant Connector Details for the merchant

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the merchant account

404.description: Merchant Connector does not exist in records

post.description:
Merchant Connector - Create

Create a new Merchant Connector for the merchant account. The connector could be a payment processor / facilitator / acquirer or specialized services like Fraud / Accounting etc."

get.description:
Merchant Connector - Retrieve

Retrieve Merchant Connector Details

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the merchant account

parameters.name: connector_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Merchant Connector

404.description: Merchant Connector does not exist in records

post.description:
Merchant Connector - Update

To update an existing Merchant Connector. Helpful in enabling / disabling different payment methods and other settings for the connector etc.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the merchant account

parameters.name: connector_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Merchant Connector

404.description: Merchant Connector does not exist in records

delete.description:
Merchant Connector - Delete

Delete or Detach a Merchant Connector from Merchant Account

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the merchant account

parameters.name: connector_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Merchant Connector

404.description: Merchant Connector does not exist in records

post.description:
Create Customer

Create a customer object and store the customer details to be reused for future payments. Incase the customer already exists in the system, this API will respond with the customer details.

List customers for a merchant

To filter and list the customers for a particular merchant id
post.operationId: List all Customers for a Merchant

To filter and list the applicable payment methods for a particular Customer ID
get.operationId: List all Payment Methods for a Customer

parameters.name: maximum_amount
parameters.description: The maximum amount amount accepted for processing by the particular payment method.

parameters.name: recurring_payment_enabled
parameters.description: Indicates whether the payment method is eligible for recurring payments

parameters.name: installment_payment_enabled
parameters.description: Indicates whether the payment method is eligible for installment payments

404.description: Payment Methods does not exist in records

get.description:
Payments Link - Retrieve

To retrieve the properties of a Payment Link. This may be used to get the status of a previously initiated payment or next action for an ongoing payment

parameters.name: payment_link_id
parameters.description: The identifier for payment link

404.description: No payment link found

post.description:
PaymentMethods - Create

To create a payment method against a customer object. In case of cards, this API could be used only by PCI compliant merchants

get.description:
Payment Method - Retrieve

To retrieve a payment method

parameters.name: method_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Payment Method

404.description: Payment Method does not exist in records

post.description:
Payment Method - Update

To update an existing payment method attached to a customer object. This API is useful for use cases such as updating the card number for expired cards to prevent discontinuity in recurring payments

parameters.name: method_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Payment Method

404.description: Payment Method does not exist in records

delete.description:
Payment Method - Delete

Delete payment method

parameters.name: method_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Payment Method

404.description: Payment Method does not exist in records

post.description:
Payments - Create

To process a payment you will have to create a payment, attach a payment method and confirm. Depending on the user journey you wish to achieve, you may opt to all the steps in a single request or in a sequence of API request using following APIs: (i) Payments - Update, (ii) Payments - Confirm, and (iii) Payments - Capture

get.description:
Payments - List

To list the payments

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the customer

parameters.name: starting_after
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination, fetch the next list after some object

parameters.name: ending_before
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination, fetch the previous list before some object

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit on the number of objects to return

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: The time at which payment is created

parameters.name: created_lt
parameters.description: Time less than the payment created time

parameters.name: created_gt
parameters.description: Time greater than the payment created time

parameters.name: created_lte
parameters.description: Time less than or equals to the payment created time

parameters.name: created_gte
parameters.description: Time greater than or equals to the payment created time

404.description: No payments found

post.description:
Payments - Session token

To create the session object or to get session token for wallets
post.operationId: Create Session tokens for a Payment

200.description: Payment session object created or session token was retrieved from wallets

get.description:
Payments - Retrieve

To retrieve the properties of a Payment. This may be used to get the status of a previously initiated payment or next action for an ongoing payment

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: The identifier for payment

200.description: Gets the payment with final status

404.description: No payment found

post.description:
Payments - Update

To update the properties of a PaymentIntent object. This may include attaching a payment method, or attaching customer object or metadata fields after the Payment is created

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: The identifier for payment

post.description:
Payments - Cancel

A Payment could can be cancelled when it is in one of these statuses: requires_payment_method, requires_capture, requires_confirmation, requires_customer_action

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: The identifier for payment

post.description:
Payments - Capture

To capture the funds for an uncaptured payment

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: The identifier for payment

post.description:
Payments - Confirm

This API is to confirm the payment request and forward payment to the payment processor. This API provides more granular control upon when the API is forwarded to the payment processor. Alternatively you can confirm the payment within the Payments Create API

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: The identifier for payment

post.description:
Refunds - Create

To create a refund against an already processed payment

Refunds - List

To list the refunds associated with a payment_id or with the merchant, if payment_id is not provided

get.description:
Refunds - Retrieve (GET)

To retrieve the properties of a Refund. This may be used to get the status of a previously initiated payment or next action for an ongoing payment

parameters.name: refund_id
parameters.description: The identifier for refund

404.description: Refund does not exist in our records

post.description:
Refunds - Update

To update the properties of a Refund object. This may include attaching a reason for the refund or metadata fields

parameters.description: The identifier for refund

connector_account_details.description: Account details of the Connector. You can specify up to 50 keys, with key names up to 40 characters long and values up to 500 characters long. Useful for storing additional, structured information on an object.

test_mode.description: A boolean value to indicate if the connector is in Test mode. By default, its value is false.

disabled.description: A boolean value to indicate if the connector is disabled. By default, its value is false.

payment_methods_enabled.description: Refers to the Parent Merchant ID if the merchant being created is a sub-merchant

metadata.description: You can specify up to 50 keys, with key names up to 40 characters long and values up to 500 characters long. Metadata is useful for storing additional, structured information on an object.

business_sub_label.description: Business Sub label of the merchant

frm_configs.description: contains the frm configs for the merchant connector

profile_id.description:
The business profile this connector must be created in
default value from merchant account is taken if not passed

applepay_verified_domains.description: identifier for the verified domains of a particular connector account

MerchantConnectorUpdate.description: Create a new Merchant Connector for the merchant account. The connector could be a payment processor / facilitator / acquirer or specialized services like Fraud / Accounting etc."

connector_label.description: Connector label for a connector, this can serve as a field to identify the connector as per business details

connector_account_details.description: Account details of the Connector. You can specify up to 50 keys, with key names up to 40 characters long and values up to 500 characters long. Useful for storing additional, structured information on an object.

test_mode.description: A boolean value to indicate if the connector is in Test mode. By default, its value is false.

disabled.description: A boolean value to indicate if the connector is disabled. By default, its value is false.

payment_methods_enabled.description: Refers to the Parent Merchant ID if the merchant being created is a sub-merchant

metadata.description: You can specify up to 50 keys, with key names up to 40 characters long and values up to 500 characters long. Metadata is useful for storing additional, structured information on an object.

frm_configs.description: contains the frm configs for the merchant connector

website.description: The business website of the merchant

about_business.description: A brief description about merchant's business
about_business.example: Online Retail with a wide selection of organic products for North America

oneOf.description: Contains the url for redirection flow
Informs the next steps for bank transfer and also contains the charges details (ex: amount received, amount charged etc)
Contains third party sdk session token response
Contains url for Qr code image, this qr code has to be shown in sdk
Contains the download url and the reference number for transaction
Contains duration for displaying a wait screen, wait screen with timer is displayed by sdk

epoch_timestamp.description: Timestamp at which session is requested

merchant_session_identifier.description: The identifier for the merchant session

nonce.description: Apple pay generated unique ID (UUID) value

domain_name.description: The domain name of the merchant which is registered in Apple Pay

display_name.description: The name to be displayed on Apple Pay button

signature.description: A string which represents the properties of a payment

operational_analytics_identifier.description: The identifier for the operational analytics

retries.description: The number of retries to get the session response

psp_id.description: The identifier for the connector transaction

order_category.description: Information about the order category that merchant wants to specify at connector level. (e.g. In Noon Payments it can take values like "pay", "food", or any other custom string set by the merchant in Noon's Dashboard)

ip_address.description: Ip address of the customer machine from which the mandate was created

user_agent.description: The user-agent of the customer's browser

product_name.description: Name of the product that is being purchased

quantity.description: The quantity of the product to be purchased

product_img_link.description: The image URL of the product

brand.description: Brand of the product that is being purchased

token.description: Token generated for the Apple pay

error_message.description: If there was an error while calling the connector the error message is received here

cancellation_reason.description: If the payment was cancelled the reason provided here

unified_code.description: error code unified across the connectors is received here if there was an error while calling connector

starting_after.description: A cursor for use in pagination, fetch the next list after some object

ending_before.description: A cursor for use in pagination, fetch the previous list before some object

limit.description: limit on the number of objects to return

created.description: The time at which payment is created

created.lt.description: Time less than the payment created time

created.gt.description: Time greater than the payment created time

created.lte.description: Time less than or equals to the payment created time

created.gte.description: Time greater than or equals to the payment created time

size.description: The number of payments included in the list

payment_method_issuer.description: The name of the bank/ provider issuing the payment method to the end user

installment_payment_enabled.description: Indicates whether the payment method is eligible for installment payments

expand_attempts.description: If enabled provides list of attempts linked to payment intent

cancellation_reason.description: The reason for the payment cancel

amount_to_capture.description: The Amount to be captured/ debited from the user's payment method.

refund_uncaptured_amount.description: Decider to refund the uncaptured amount

statement_descriptor_suffix.description: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements.

payment_id.description:
Unique identifier for the payment. This ensures idempotency for multiple payments
that have been done by a single merchant. This field is auto generated and is returned in the API response.

merchant_id.description:
This is an identifier for the merchant account. This is inferred from the API key
provided during the request

amount.description: The payment amount. Amount for the payment in lowest denomination of the currency. (i.e) in cents for USD denomination, in paisa for INR denomination etc.,

connector.description: This allows the merchant to manually select a connector with which the payment can go through

amount_to_capture.description:
The Amount to be captured/ debited from the users payment method. It shall be in lowest denomination of the currency. (i.e) in cents for USD denomination, in paisa for INR denomination etc.,
If not provided, the default amount_to_capture will be the payment amount.

capture_on.description:
A timestamp (ISO 8601 code) that determines when the payment should be captured.
Providing this field will automatically set `capture` to true

confirm.description: Whether to confirm the payment (if applicable)

customer_id.description:
The identifier for the customer object.
This field will be deprecated soon, use the customer object instead

email.description:
The customer's email address
This field will be deprecated soon, use the customer object instead

name.description:
description: The customer's name
This field will be deprecated soon, use the customer object instead

phone.description:
The customer's phone number
This field will be deprecated soon, use the customer object instead

phone_country_code.description:
The country code for the customer phone number
This field will be deprecated soon, use the customer object instead

off_session.description: Set to true to indicate that the customer is not in your checkout flow during this payment, and therefore is unable to authenticate. This parameter is intended for scenarios where you collect card details and charge them later. This parameter can only be used with `confirm: true`.

return_url.description: The URL to redirect after the completion of the operation

payment_token.description: Provide a reference to a stored payment method

card_cvc.description:
This is used when payment is to be confirmed and the card is not saved.
This field will be deprecated soon, use the CardToken object instead

statement_descriptor_name.description: For non-card charges, you can use this value as the complete description that appears on your customers’ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

statement_descriptor_suffix.description: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

order_details.description: Information about the product , quantity and amount for connectors. (e.g. Klarna)

client_secret.description: It's a token used for client side verification.

mandate_id.description: A unique identifier to link the payment to a mandate, can be use instead of payment_method_data

business_label.description: Business label of the merchant for this payment

allowed_payment_method_types.description: Allowed Payment Method Types for a given PaymentIntent

business_sub_label.description: Business sub label for the payment

The business profile to use for this payment, if not passed the default business profile
associated with the merchant account will be used.

merchant_id.description: The identifier for the Merchant Account.

key_id.description: The identifier for the API Key.

revoked.description: Indicates whether the API key was revoked or not.

RoutingAlgorithm.description: The routing algorithm to be used to process the incoming request from merchant to outgoing payment processor or payment method. The default is 'Custom'

token.description: The encrypted payment token from Samsung

email.description: The Email ID for SEPA and BACS billing

name.description: The billing name for SEPA and BACS billing

iban.description: International Bank Account Number (iban) - used in many countries for identifying a bank along with it's customer.

bic.description: [8 / 11 digits] Bank Identifier Code (bic) / Swift Code - used in many countries for identifying a bank and it's branches

display_tax_on_surcharge_amount.description: tax on surcharge amount for this payment

start_time.description: The start time to filter payments list or to get list of filters. To get list of filters start time is needed to be passed

end_time.description: The end time to filter payments list or to get list of filters. If not passed the default time is now

name.description: A unique name for the API Key to help you identify it.

description.description: A description to provide more context about the API Key.
description.example: Key used by our developers to integrate with the sandbox environment

webhook_username.description: The user name for Webhook login

webhook_url.description: The url for the webhook endpoint

payment_succeeded_enabled.description: If this property is true, a webhook message is posted whenever a payment is successful

payment_failed_enabled.description: If this property is true, a webhook message is posted whenever a payment fails

admin_api_key.description: Admin API keys allow you to perform some privileged actions such as creating a merchant account and Merchant Connector account.

api_key.name: api-key
api_key.description: API keys are the most common method of authentication and can be obtained from the HyperSwitch dashboard.

ephemeral_key.name: api-key
ephemeral_key.description: Ephemeral keys provide temporary access to singular data, such as access to a single customer object for a short period of time.

publishable_key.name: api-key
publishable_key.description: Publishable keys are a type of keys that can be public and have limited scope of usage.

tags.name: Merchant Connector Account
tags.description: Create and manage merchant connector accounts

tags.name: Payments
tags.description: Create and manage one-time payments, recurring payments and mandates

tags.name: Refunds
tags.description: Create and manage refunds for successful payments

tags.name: Payment Methods
tags.description: Create and manage payment methods of customers
